node.html:
Despite storm Ciara thats hitting the UK this weekend with its high winds and pouring rain, spring is just around the corner, although you wouldn't think it today !

However this is the beginning of the new walking season for this year and we’ll be keeping you posted of our regular Guided Walks programme on here and other social media sites. First up is a lovely walk in the waterfalls area of the Brecon Beacons National Park. It takes in several impressive falls culminating with the beautiful Sgwyd Y Eira falls. **Details are here. To book on these walks, see details below.**

Walk Title: Waterfalls Circular Start Point: Pontneddfechan When: 16/02/2020 at 09:30 Distance: 8 miles

Walk Description: This is a lovely walk taking in 3 beautiful river valleys, the Nedd Fechan, the Afon Mellte and the afon Hepste with their very impressive waterfalls, including Sgwyrd Y Eira or ‘falls of snow in English. We walk in many places along the river banks with their woodland and flora and fauna including dippers and otters. The walk is along paths but it can be muddy and slippery in places and there are a few steepish sections when we traverse the steep valleys. The estimated time of the walk including breaks is approx 5hrs. Dont forget to bring along food, drink and a camera ! We’ll meet in the usual place on the steps of the National Museum and drive to the start point.

Walk Leader is Clive 07775 444176 Price: £10 per person

Walk Title: Sugar Loaf walk Start Point: Abergavenny When: 23/02/2020 at 09:30 Distance: 6 miles

Walk Description: This walk takes us from the small market town of Abergavenny through lovely woodland following streams to the foot of the hill of Pen Y Fal, commonly known as the Sugarloaf. We’ll make the ascent to the summit for lunch while we enjoy the extensive views over the beautiful Usk Valley. We’ll return by a different route, while again descending through lovely woodland.

Dont forget to bring along food, drink and a camera ! We’ll meet in the usual place on the steps of the National Museum and drive to the start point.

Walk Leader: Clive 07775 444176 Price:£10 per person

The price of each walk is £0 per person, however please email Clive or phone on 07775 444176 to book and confirm your place on a walk.

We meet in on the front steps of the National Museum in central Cardiff at 09:30, (unless stated above), and you can pay on the day. Please try to have boots or sturdy walking shoes and try to avoid wearing jeans if possible and of course, bring along a waterproof jacket; remember, this is Wales and it’s sometimes wet !!!
